element.name: An alternative version of a familiar location
Special floor plate which affects things on it
Barriers which only let through specific things
The edge of the playable area takes the player to the opposite side
The playable area changes in size

secondHalf.singular: offers a good view of the area
secondHalf.plural: offer a good view of the area

element.name: Safe places where the player can restock resources
The world lives even if the player is away
Things follow or latch onto the character
Benefitting from things another character did
Choosing the right character for a certain task
Certain actions require that the character's hands are empty
A protective suit is required to survive
Other players can join and leave anytime
Separating a character/unit from its group
Temporarily excluding a player from the action
Multiple players control the same entity
Using multiple players' abilities in tandem
Sharing designs or strategies with other players
Sharing money, resources or points with other players
Non-player characters look identical to the player character
Converting enemies to the player's team
Being undercover as a member of a different team
Temporary alliance against a common threat
Fighting with teammates over a reward
An object is biased towards or against a certain team
Progress is prevented if members of multiple teams are present

secondHalf.singular: if members of multiple teams are present

element.name: Naming a character, place or an object
Moving a part of the environment
Removing a part of a system makes the rest fall
Removing something useful from the opponent
Securing an advantage before the opponent can
Setting up a camp or work site
A source of power or resources needs maintenance
Some rules can be broken, intentionally or not
One player's decision affects other players
Funneling liquid or a mass of things down a certain path
Attaching things to the floor or walls
Dead/frozen characters remain as parts of the environment

secondHalf.singular: is a part of the environment

element.name: The AI learns from the players actions
The gameplay relies on the mouse cursor
The controls consist of only one or two buttons
An action's or item's effectiveness depends on the surroundings
An action's or item's effectiveness depends on its type
An action's or item's effectiveness depends on the target's state
Doing something quicker yields better results
Spending more time on something yields better results
An event doesn't wait for the player before starting or ending
An event keeps repeating until the player does something
Refraining from doing or using something is preferable
Choosing whether to accept a perk or reward
Getting back lost items or power
Rewards disappear if not collected quickly enough
Abandoning a helpful thing as a last resort
Leaving characters or objects undisturbed lets them recover
Leaving inflicted characters or objects unattended causes further harm to them
Leaving threats undisturbed lets them grow stronger
Interrupting an enemy's attack or ability
Being defeated makes the threat more difficult
Tricking the player into making mistakes
Failed attempts leave marks in the world

secondHalf.singular: leaves a mark in the world

element.name: Leaving a mark on anything that is touched
Two things cancel each other when coming into contact

secondHalf.singular: when coming into contact with something

element.name: Things of the same family enhance each other
An object and parts separated from it are linked
element.firstHalf: An object and parts separated from it

element.name: A machine needs an operator to function
Being hit by a falling object
Being taken to safety after suffering a grave injury
Previewing things which haven't been unlocked yet
Marking things to make others focus on them
Selecting multiple things at the same time
A log of the player's past choices
A normally positive thing causes a negative effect under certain conditions
Being affected by staying close to certain things
Being affected by certain events happening nearby
Looking at/away from something causes an effect
Something happens only if the player moves
An object gives feedback when getting closer to another
It's impossible to go beyond a maximum distance of something
A unique ability no one else has
A certain object or material takes away invulnerability

element.name: Taking over another character after dying
Transferring one's mind into a different body
Characters or objects can fuse and form a single entity
Gaining or losing something after an event ends
Revealing the locations of enemies or items
Power can quickly increase but can also be easily lost
Losing abilities or items is necessary to progress
Moving in a straight line with a steady speed
Shooting at a point to teleport there
Being carried by a creature or force
Returning to where the player failed
Operating a vehicle as a team
Being a passenger in a vehicle
Leaving a vehicle to do something
Attacking leaves the character vulnerable to opponents' attacks
Focusing attacks on certain parts of the target
Weapon or ammunition can get stuck in the target
Destroying projectiles before they cause damage
Destroying the target's armor before it can be damaged
Taking advantage of an enemy's positioning
Pushing enemies or objects off ledges
Deliberately being in harm's way to protect the team
Using objects in the world as ammunition
Weapons can be found in the world

secondHalf.singular: can be found in the world

element.name: The equipped weapon changes after getting a kill
Simultaneously being a hunter and a target
No respawning until the round/wave ends
Player character's death causes enemies to respawn
Enemies which boost or heal others
Weak, fleeing enemies with good loot
Enemy spawn points can be destroyed or otherwise tampered with
Enemies alert others of the player
Enemies have predetermined paths or positions
Enemies which pretend to not be hostile
Enemies or neutral characters attack when provoked
Using certain tools or abilities on certain objects

element.name: Multiple ways to solve a problem
Tutorials can always be read, viewed or played again
The more the player knows, the more efficient they become
Letting the player figure out new mechanics without explaining much
Encouraging the player to use new tactics
Familiar mechanics used in novel ways
Revisiting places with new tools or abilities
Repeating past events or levels with new knowledge
Helping the player's future self via time travel or recording actions
Catching the correct one among its copies
Used options are locked out of play
The player's choices affect the story or gameplay opportunities
Making custom markings on a map
Maps are stored in the inventory
Trade goods are valued differently in different places

secondHalf.singular: is valued differently in different places
secondHalf.plural: are valued differently in different places

element.name: Unneeded items or perks can be stored for another character

secondHalf.singular: can be stored for another character

element.name: Combining items with different stats and features
Assembling an item from parts with different stats and features

secondHalf.plural: improve by spending time with them

It's impossible to get any more of a certain resource
Once discovered or unlocked, an item starts appearing all around the world
Factions use different gear or vehicles

Having too many items is a problem
Carrying an item causes a harmful effect

Reaching a point in the world
Limited time to get the highest score
Limited time to reach a location
Objectives are decided by the player
The objective may unexpectedly change because of story reasons
Clearing the way to the destination
Taking over territory or capture points
Finding a home or other safe place
Taking an item to a specific location

element.name: One of the players decides who earns a reward
Getting rid of things until there's nothing left
Proving the player's skills or knowledge

Keeping the game camera centered on a target
Minimal or no animation between key poses
A character's or an object's status is visualized
A character's or an object's path is visualized
Audio/visual cues for nearby hazards or points of interest
Someone or something makes noise somewhere out of sight
Seeing characters or objects through walls
Players see or hear different things
Filtering out certain images or sounds
In-game music player for the soundtrack
Alternative cosmetic items for the player character or UI
Chances to be saved from tough situations
Chances to fix the player's mistakes

Notifications or characters will tell if something is wrong

Sudden change in the middle of action

A lot to keep track of at the same time

element.name: Saving things as favorites to access them more quickly
